attributes.action: AGM vote on Company Remuneration Committee recommendations for Directors' pay should be legally binding
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The gulf between those on the gravy train and those on the company's lower-floors continues to widen despite the spector of the Credit Crunch and recession. 'The haves' participation in the mutual back-scratching through the laundering mechanism of a 'remuneration committee' has been increasingly creative in sustaining rewards that ignore the financial context and wider economic landscape. Share holders' will 
as expressed in AGM votes has been frustrated by being non-binding on boards. It's time this ended!
